claim(bytes32,uint256,address,address,ad.details: To query the arguments of this function, get the "Lockup" event logs for the SHA256 hash of the preimage

params.amount: Amount locked in the contract for the swap in the smallest denomination of the token
params.claimAddress: Address to which the claimed funds will be sent
params.refundAddress: Address that locked the tokens in the contract
params.timelock: Block height after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token locked for the swap

claim(bytes32,uint256,address,address,ui.details: To query the arguments of this function, get the "Lockup" event logs for the SHA256 hash of the preimage

params.amount: Amount locked in the contract for the swap in the smallest denomination of the token
params.refundAddress: Address that locked the tokens in the contract
params.timelock: Block height after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token locked for the swap

claimBatch(address,bytes32[],uint256[],a.details: All swaps that are claimed have to have "msg.sender" as "claimAddress" and the same token address

params.amounts: Amounts that are locked in the contract for the swap in WEI
params.refundAddresses: Addresses that locked the tokens in the contract
params.timelocks: Block heights after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token of the swap

params.amount: Amount the swap has locked in the smallest denomination of the token
params.claimAddress: Address that can claim the locked tokens
params.refundAddress: Address that locked the tokens and can refund them
params.timelock: Block height after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token of the swap

lock(bytes32,uint256,address,address,uin.details: This function is "public" so that it can be called from the outside and "lockPrepayMinerfee" function

params.amount: Amount to be locked in the contract
params.claimAddress: Address that can claim the locked tokens
params.timelock: Block height after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token to be locked

lockPrepayMinerfee(bytes32,uint256,addre.details: Make sure to set a reasonable gas limit for calling this function, else a malicious contract at the claim address could drain your Ether

params.amount: Amount that should be locked in the contract in the smallest denomination of the token
params.claimAddress: Address that can claim the locked tokens
params.timelock: Block height after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token that should be locked in the contract

refund(bytes32,uint256,address,address,a.details: To query the arguments of this function, get the "Lockup" event logs for your refund address and the preimage hash if you have itFor further explanations and reasoning behind the statements in this function, check the "claim" function

params.amount: Amount locked in the contract for the swap in the smallest denomination of the token
params.claimAddress: Address that was destined to claim the funds
params.refundAddress: Address that locked the tokens in the contract
params.timelock: Block height after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token locked for the swap

refund(bytes32,uint256,address,address,u.details: To query the arguments of this function, get the "Lockup" event logs for your refund address and the preimage hash if you have itFor further explanations and reasoning behind the statements in this function, check the "claim" function

params.amount: Amount locked in the contract for the swap in the smallest denomination of the token
params.claimAddress: Address that that was destined to claim the funds
params.timelock: Block height after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token locked for the swap

refundCooperative(bytes32,uint256,addres.details: To query the arguments of this function, get the "Lockup" event logs for your refund address and the preimage hash if you have itFor further explanations and reasoning behind the statements in this function, check the "claim" function

params.amount: Amount locked in the contract for the swap in the smallest denomination of the token
params.claimAddress: Address that that was destined to claim the funds
params.timelock: Block height after which the locked tokens can be refunded
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token locked for the swap

claim(bytes32,uint256,address,address,ad.notice: Claims tokens locked in the contract for a specified claim address

claim(bytes32,uint256,address,address,ui.notice: Claims tokens locked in the contract

hashValues(bytes32,uint256,address,addre.notice: Hashes all the values of a swap with Keccak256

lock(bytes32,uint256,address,address,uin.notice: Locks tokens in the contractThe refund address is the sender of the transaction

lockPrepayMinerfee(bytes32,uint256,addre.notice: Locks tokens for a swap in the contract and forwards a specified amount of Ether to the claim addressThe amount of Ether forwarded to the claim address is the amount sent in the transaction and the refund address is the sender of the transaction

refund(bytes32,uint256,address,address,a.notice: Refunds tokens locked in the contract after the timeout for a specified refund address

refund(bytes32,uint256,address,address,u.notice: Refunds tokens locked in the contract after the timeout

refundCooperative(bytes32,uint256,addres.notice: Refunds tokens locked in the contract with an EIP-712 signature of the claimAddress
